config.orimod.spirit_management.default_: The Default State mandates whether or not new saves (or new players, on servers) will start out as a Spirit by default.
config.orimod.spirit_management.force_st: If enabled, all players, including those that have the permission to change whether or not they are a Spirit, will be forced to either be a Player or a Spirit based on the Default State.
config.orimod.spirit_management.allow_ch: Whether or not to allow players to change between Player and Spirit. There is a permissions file that dictates who is explicitly allowed to, and who is explicitly not allowed to, which can be used to override this value per player.
config.orimod.spirit_management.change_m: What operator permission level must a player have to use /spirit set on themselves?
config.orimod.spirit_management.change_a: What operator permission level must a player have to use /spirit ability on themselves?
config.orimod.spirit_management.change_m: What operator permission level must a player have to use /spirit set on other players?
config.orimod.spirit_management.change_a: What operator permission level must a player have to use /spirit ability on other players?
config.orimod.spirit_limits.only_eat_pla: Foodstuffs that classify as meat will be inedible by Spirits if this is enabled.
config.orimod.spirit_limits.self_repair_: Some tools and devices allow Spirits to use their own life energy as a means of repair. This determines the extent in which that is possible.
config.orimod.spirit_limits.anyone_can_s: Under normal circumstances, non-spirit players cannot use their life to repair hardlight tools. If this is true, this limitation is bypassed.
config.orimod.spirit_limits.self_repair_: How much health does a single self-powered repair take? Note that 2 health is 1 heart.
How much durability gets restored when repairing with your own energy?
config.orimod.light_energy.rf_to_lux.des: How much ยงcRF ยงfis required to get 1 ยงbLuxen.
config.orimod.light_energy.env_power.des: ยงcThis is not yet functional.ยงf If enabled, environments of ยง5Decay ยงfor ยงbLight ยงfwill reduce or improve the efficiency of Light-based devices, making it harder to run machines in ยง5Decay ยงfenvironments and easier in ยงbLight ยงfenvironments.
config.orimod.light_energy.show_rf.descr: ยงdRequires mod: Jade ยงr-- This determines when to display the RF equivalent of any given amount of Luxen.
config.orimod.rendering.assembly_debug.d: The ยงbAยงfssembly ยงbOยงfptimization ยงbSยงfystem is responsible for allowing excessively large machines to have low CPU usage. This option will cause debugging info for the AOS to show when the debug menu (F3) is open. ยงcThis feature can make the debug menu very laggy!ยงf
config.orimod.rendering.override_health_: If enabled, the vanilla heart renderer (on your HUD) is disabled and replaced with a near-identical implementation from this mod. This enables support for custom heart types when inflicted with effects like Decay, but may also cause compatibility issues with mods that change how health renders.
config.orimod.world.spirit_materials.des: Binds blocks or block states to a specific SpiritMaterial, which changes the sound when stepping on a block of that material.
config.orimod.world.decay.spreading.desc: Dictates how all ยง5Decay ยงfspreads in the world. It can either spread (spreads on random ticks, replaces blocks it can infect), not spread, or flat out not exist (it will cure or remove itself on random ticks)
config.orimod.world.decay.surface_coatin: Dictates how all ยง5Decay Surface Mycelium ยงfspreads in the world. This setting functions identically to the normal spread setting otherwise. ยงcThis is limited by the general spread settingsยงf.
config.orimod.world.decay.fluid.descript: Dictates how all ยง5Decay Poison ยงfspreads in the world. This block is particularly aggressive in that it infects and replaces water. This setting functions identically to the normal spread setting otherwise. ยงcThis is limited by the general spread settingsยงf.
config.orimod.world.decay.diagonal_sprea: If enabled, ยง5Decay ยงfblocks can spread diagonally by one block. This has somewhat of a performance impact (albeit minor). If disabled, they will only spread to the six direct neighbors to any given block, but can leverage a performance boost.
config.orimod.assembly_optimization_syst: This can be used to keep chunks containing functional Light tech (ยง7meaning they must be doing something with their energyยงf) alive. This ยงaimproves gameplay by allowing tech to operate whilst unattended ยงfat the cost of ยงcmore CPU usage (the usage scales with how much is going on)ยงf.

Big sets of wires and devices are complicated. This setting decides how many + or T shaped wire joints the system can go through when searching for connected technology blocks. If there's too many branches, the system determines the assembly to be too complicated and gives up partway through. Higher values allow more largely interconnected machines, but also introduce a significant amount of server lag when changing the wiring (thankfully, there is not lag from the system existing, only from it changing).
config.orimod.spirit_management.use_old_: Before v2.0.0, the 5 heart limit was imposed by dividing the total max health by 2. This interfered with changes to max health adversely, and so it was changed to subtraction instead. If this change has broken your server or save, turn this setting on to go back to the old divide method.
